title: Understanding Entropy
text: Entropy is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system. When a system becomes more ordered, its entropy decreases, and when it becomes more disordered, its entropy increases.

title: Phase Separation and Entropy
text: Consider what happens to the entropy when a mixture is separated into its pure components. Does the system become more ordered or disordered?

title: Entropy Change in Distillation
text: In fractional distillation, a mixture is separated into pure substances. Think about whether the separation into pure substances increases or decreases the disorder of the system.

title: Comparing Mixture and Pure Substances
text: A mixture of ethanol and water is more disordered than pure ethanol and pure water. Consider how this affects the entropy change when the mixture is separated.

title: Final Consideration
text: When a system transitions from a mixed state to a more ordered state of pure substances, the entropy typically decreases. Keep this in mind when predicting the sign of the entropy change.
